title: Easter Weekend: Cops seek divine intervention! | Daily Sun
text: EASTERN Cape police came together to ask for divine intervention. Nelson Mandela Bay District police officers held a pre-Easter Service at the Presbyterian Church of Africa in Motherwell on Friday, 22 March. The service was attended by community members, churches, and different units within the police department. The service intended to pray for the end of murders, to restore morals, and to end corruption within the police. They also prayed for the health and wellness of members during the Easter holidays. District commissioner Major-General Vuyisile Ncata said: "We are holding a pre-Easter prayer service because, as police in this region, we believe that in order to win the battle against crime, we need to be close to Jesus Christ and also have the fear of the Lord. "We are dealing with a type of crime that is no longer just physical, and as police alone, we will not be able to win this battle. Therefore, we are collaborating with all the organisations in the district, and we believe that the Lord will help us in the fight against crime," he said. Also, as police officers, we also want to be prayed for so that we do not become criminals ourselves and do not conflict with the law. "We also pray for peace and pray for no crime. We pray for wisdom and knowledge as we lead, especially currently. This is a very busy and difficult period in our country,‚Äù he said. Ncata added that criminals needed to find them ready, strong, and empowered with Christ. Nelson Mandela District Spiritual Crime Chairperson Luvuyo Rheza said: "It‚Äôs very painful to see our people destroying each other. We believe prayer is powerful. Prayer brings unity to our communities and love for each other. "We are praying to God to protect us and our children from this [murders] evil spirit. These are the last days that we are living in, which is why we are encouraging the community to pray together and overcome these evil spirits among the people," he said. author: YOUNUS RASHID / ARIF RASHID
title: Young women innovators develop prototype drone for soil testing
text:
Srinagar, Feb 25: Marking a significant achievement, two young women innovators from Kashmir, Simran Altaf and Syed Fakiha, have developed a prototype drone for real-time soil testing. They said that the device accurately determines the amount of fertilizers and other inputs the soil needs, reducing labour costs and improving productivity.
The innovators showcased their work at the GONGUL 10th Agritech Mela at Sher-e-Kashmir University of Agricultural Sciences and Technology (SKUAST-K) Srinagar.
Simran Altaf, a B.Tech graduate in Electronics and Communication from Kashmir University, is one of the developers of the soil-testing drone. She said, ‚ÄúMy batchmate Syed Fakiha and I worked together on this project from the beginning.‚Äù
‚ÄúWe have our own lab, and it took us about six months to develop the prototype,‚Äù they said.
‚ÄúThe name of our startup is CropCopter Innovations Pvt. Ltd. Our innovation focuses on soil testing through a smart IoT-based soil analyzer. We have deployed a sensor pod in our drone, which is equipped with all the necessary sensors. It tests the soil in real time,‚Äù she said.
Simran further said that their initial model, a standalone sensor pod, was not functional, which led them to integrate it into a drone.
She said that when the Chief Minister Omar Abdullah visited SKUAST during the event he gave them positive feedback on their innovation, praising it as a valuable concept.
‚ÄúWe faced hurdles in developing the prototype and transforming it into a drone. Initially, our project focused on a standalone sensor pod, which we developed independently. Later, we converted it into a drone with some assistance from the incubator at SKUAST-K, where we received a grant. However, the pod itself was developed entirely on our own,‚Äù she added.
Simran encouraged aspiring innovators to come forward with their ideas, emphasising that there is now more awareness about innovation. ‚ÄúI urge the government to support us so we can bring more technologies to the forefront,‚Äù she said.
‚ÄúThe cost of developing the prototype has already reached Rs 5 lakh. However, we are still working on it, testing its capabilities, and determining what improvements can be made. The cost may be reduced, and the final version will be ready for testing in a few months,‚Äù she said.
‚ÄúFor soil testing, multiple samples need to be collected, making the process expensive. Our drone will reduce costs, including labour expenses. It will also ensure that fertilizers are applied in the right quantity, improving productivity. With the global population increasing, demand for efficient agricultural solutions is also rising. I believe this is one of the best ideas to address this challenge,‚Äù she added.

author: Carla Mascarenhas
title: Australia braces for scorching heatwave across southeast
text: Australians are set to swelter over the next few days with parts of the country hitting 40 degrees. The Bureau of Meteorology (BoM) says a heatwave affecting Western Australia will move south-east peaking across South Australia on December 15 and Victoria and inland NSW on December 16. Maximum temperatures will be up to 14 degrees above the average for December. The worst hit areas in regional NSW will be Ivanhoe and Wilcannia which are forecast to peak at 48 degrees on December 16. Mildura, Griffith and Tibooburra will hit 45 degrees. While in Victoria, Bendigo will peak at 43 degrees and Bairnsdale and Ballarat will get to 38 degrees by December 16. A Weatherzone alert said the heatwave would bring the highest temperatures of the year to much of Victoria, including Melbourne as well as Victoria's first 45 degree day in four years. "Current forecasts suggest the temperature in Melbourne should reach the low thirties on Sunday before soaring to 40 degrees on Monday," the alert said. "If it gets this hot, it would be Melbourne's first 40 degree day of 2024." BOM senior meteorologist Miriam Bradbury told ACM the heat would "build across southeastern parts of Australia, fuelled by strong winds," on December 13 and December 14. "It's mainly impacting southern parts of Western Australia currently," she said. "They are sitting in the midst of the most significant heatwave that they've seen so far this summer. "But it is not going to be until later today and into tomorrow that this heat starts shifting eastwards and pushing into the eastern states." Ms Bradbury said on December 15 and 16 the heatwave conditions would "ramp up" in Victoria, South Australia, Tasmania and inland NSW. 'Many areas will push up into the mid to high 30s at least, if not the low to mid 40s, in particular those hottest temperatures reaching even high 40s across inland parts of NSW and some northern parts of Victoria as well," she said. Coastal areas, that benefit from sea breezes, would manage to escape the worst of the heatwave, she said. The cool change should hit inland NSW late on December 17 and 18 but other areas should experience relief earlier. READ MORE: Australia faces wet, hot summer with some 'unbearable' nights ahead: BoM

author: Statesman News Service
title: Shah holds mega roadshows in Gujarat; to file nomination tomorrow - The Statesman
text:
Ahead of the single-phase Lok Sabha polling in Gujarat on May 7, Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Thursday held mega roadshows in Ahmedabad and Gandhinagar.
Gujarat Chief Minister Bhupendra Patel accompanied Mr Shah in the Ahmedabad roadshow from Sardar Patel Chowk to K K Nagar.
The roadshows saw a sea of people and party workers walking along Mr Amit Shah‚Äôs open-roofed vehicle. While his vehicle received a huge flower shower from supporters, flowers were showered on the public from his vehicle too.
Mr Shah greeted people standing on both sides of the road to get a glimpse of the BJP leader. In the Gandhinagar roadshow, Mr Shah accepted a turban offered by his supporters and wore it. In Kalol, the roadshow was greeted by a huge crowd.
Slogans of ‚ÄúJai Shree Ram ‚Äù and ‚ÄúBharat Mata ki Jai ‚Äù were also raised in the roadshow. One roadshow commenced at APMC Circle and ended at Nalsarovar Chowk. The Home Minister will file his nomination for the Gandhinagar Lok Sabha seat on Friday.
The Congress has pitted Sonal Patel from the Gandhinagar seat against Mr Shah, who is eyeing a second consecutive term. All 26 seats of Gujarat go to the polls in a single phase on 7 May.
One of the key seats for the BJP is Ahmedabad West. It is currently represented by BJP leader Kirit Premjibhai Solanki. This constituency came into existence after the delimitation in 2008.
From Ahmedabad East constituency, the BJP has fielded Hasmukh Patel. The BJP whitewashed the Congress in the 2019 and 2014 general elections by winning all 26 constituencies in Gujarat, the home state of Prime Minister Narendra Modi.
Under Mr Shah‚Äôs leadership, the Union Home Ministry followed a firm stand on protecting the country and citizens from threats of terrorism and naxalism. There was a zero tolerance policy on terrorism.
The government enacted Bharatiya Nyay Sanhita to ensure security as well as justice delivery for citizens. The government enacted the Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA) and will implement it to confer citizenship to all eligible persons.
